lead_paragraph: Gov. Pat McCrory and the Justice Department are clashing over transgender rights after the department said that the state had violated the Civil Rights Act of 1964 with its law on bathroom access.

byline.contributor: Alan Blinder reported from Raleigh, Richard Pérez-Peña from New York, and Eric Lichtblau from Washington. Gardiner Harris contributed reporting from Washington.
byline.original: By ALAN BLINDER, RICHARD PÉREZ-PEÑA and ERIC LICHTBLAU

headline.print_headline: North Carolina and U.S. Duel on Access Law
headline.main: Countersuits Over North Carolina’s Bias Law

snippet: Gov. Pat McCrory and the Justice Department are clashing over transgender rights after the department said that the state had violated the Civil Rights Act of 1964 with its law on bathroom access.
abstract: North Carolina Gov Pat McCrory and Justice Dept file dueling lawsuits over bathroom access for transgender individuals; Justice Dept argues that state has violated Civil Rights Act of 1964, while McCrory accuses agency of 'baseless and blatant overreach.'
